result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley E. Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Any contact between Ashley and the victim, R.B., will be determined by the Agent.
Domestic Violence Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.
Anger Management Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.
Any Assessments and Counseling as recommended by DOC.
DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided.
Defendant shall submit a payment with amount deemed appropriate by the agent on a monthly basis.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber - STAYED - Court reserves the right to impose upon recommendation of Agent.
Transfer permitted.
